sourcesContent:
import React from 'react'
  import { MDXTag } from '@mdx-js/tag'
  

export default class MDXContent extends React.Component {
  constructor(props) {
    super(props)
    this.layout = null
  }
  render() {
    const { components, ...props } = this.props

    return <MDXTag
             name="wrapper"
             
             components={components}><MDXTag name="h1" components={components} props={{"id":"api-introduction"}}>{`API Introduction`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`REflex is a user-centric pub/sub system that uses `}<MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"href":"https://www.w3.org/TR/ldn/"}}>{`Linked Data Notifications (LDN)`}</MDXTag>{`
to enable sharing and reuse of notifications across applications, regardless of how they were generated. `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Instead of treating notifications as ephemeral or non-persistent entities, this specification enables the notion of a
notification as an individual entity with its own URI. As such, notifications can be retrieved and reused. `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`The API is very simple, the only interactions are publish a message (HTTP POST) and get messages either pushed to your
application or with HTTP GET.  All the magic is in the `}<MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"href":"schema-introduction.md"}}>{`schemas`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
           </MDXTag>
  }
}
